page.title: 03Gelli Werdd Park, Glanaman.
page.content: Gelli Werdd Park opened in 1969 on the site of the old Gelli Ceidrim Colliery. Covering approximately twenty acres between the villages of Glanaman and Garnant, it is a major feature of the local landscape. Its steep hillside aspect is traversed by a number of gently sloping footpaths, allowing observers fine views of the village and surrounding area. The park includes a children's playground, as well as areas of coniferous and deciduous woodland. Its natural character allows trees and wild plants to grow largely undisturbed, providing an important habitat for many species of butterfly. The park offers a safe area for studies by the school,and provides the local people with an unspoiled environment for their leisure hours.
